comments:
If you remove a .java file from your file system (any one) and don't refresh
your package view, you will get a FileNotFound exception on the log file, and a
"Internal error while creating a change object. Consult..." on the UI when you
try do refactor a class (changing the name for exemple).

Here is a part of my log file.

This happens when textual updating is requested. Obviously we don't check in 
this case if the workspace is in sync with the underlying. Not critical for 
3.0, since the problem occurrs during precondition change and the workspace 
isn't toched yet. 

Markus, we should sit together at the beginning of 3.1 and discuss how we can 
come up with a more generic solution here. May be the refactoring framework 
would interpret those exceptions and simply show a fatal error instead of 
locking this.
It's a user error to modify workspace content outside Eclipse and not call refresh. I don't think we should add extra checks for that.
